name: Mayday Mayday
description:
You are piloting a biplane flying through wonderful sky of slightly blueish color, when you suddenly notice a fleet of angry rad battle planes flying towards you. So you decide to start yelling and shooting back. Control your plane with your voice! The louder you scream the higher you fly! Before playing in the browser you have to give access to the microphone. If the controls feel too responsive, try lowering your microphone volume or stand further away from it.

All assets in the game are created by me with the exception of the font. which you can find here: https://www.dafont.com/jet-pilot.font

I made the game in Godot engine (and o Lord how i love the engine). Art was made in Aseprite, I cannot recommend this software enough. The sound was made in bfxr.

I prepared a bit for this week's theme, when I saw that this theme was winning, I decided to try some prototypes in Godot. However, I did so just to learn the ways Godot handles audio input (and it is rather weird) and I didn't copy/paste any code I made previously.

I managed to implement the voice controls (player needs exactly 0 buttons to play the game). I also implemented 1 enemy type that is spawning in increasing frequency, enemies are flying across the screen and shooting at you. I did implement a simple particle effect (my first particle effect in Godot I believe) and sounds for shooting and explosions. I was left with around 1 minute of time, so I didn't manage to record any music this time.

Source code can be found here: https://github.com/althaj/Mayday-Mayday
